DOC.brief_summary: High protein diet popular among Maori , especially East Coast North Island . The purpose study compare metabolic effect moderate carbohydrate , high protein diet ( MCHP ) high carbohydrate-high fibre ( HCHF ) diet insulin sensitivity Maori increase risk develop diabetes cardiovascular disease .
DOC.brief_title: He Purongo Mo Nga Kai Hei Arai Te Matehuka â€“ Dietary Diabetes Prevention Study Maori
DOC.detailed_description: This 6-month pilot intervention study self-identifying Maori participant randomise control trial conduct Dunedin Invercargill . The study consist three , two month phase conduct period six month . Participants meet inclusion criterion randomise three group : moderate carbohydrate-high protein ( MCHP ) , high carbohydrate-high fibre ( HCHF ) control group . Those randomised experimental diet recommend energy intake base current BMI level . The aim phase one achieve weight loss weekly advice support research team . The aim phase two weight maintenance continue weekly advice support . Phase three consist weight maintenance phase without support . Those control group instruct follow self select diet plan . Outcome determine examine surrogate clinical endpoint . The clinical endpoint include follow record measurement anthropometric measurement , bioelectrical impedance measurement , profile mood state questionnaire , activity questionnaire , three day diet record collect 0 , 2 , 4 6 month period . Biochemical measure lipid profile , fast insulin glucose , liver function uric acid level also conduct .
DOC.criteria: Self identify Maori age 1775 year Male female Nondiabetic Resident Dunedin Invercargill BMI > 27 Family history T2D The presence diabetes , renal liver failure , medical condition unstable potential partcipants currently active treatment .
